thread.title: Denny Hamlin's Daytona 500 paint schemes and results
thread.title_full: Denny Hamlin's Daytona 500 paint schemes and results

title: Denny Hamlin's Daytona 500 paint schemes and results
text:
Feb 14, 2017 at 4:36p ET 0Shares 
It took 11 races for Denny Hamlin to become a Daytona 500 champion, which is less time than it took some of the best drivers in NASCAR to win the Great American Race. 
Check out the defending Daytona 500 winner’s history at the track: NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images 2006 
One of the most impressive rookie seasons in NASCAR history didn’t start off on a bright note. Hamlin started the race in 17 th and finished 30 th in his first 500. no commercial use without express written consent-Copyright Robert LeSieur USA tel 843 672 9777or 704 534 7171-RobertLeSie Copyright Robert LeSieur 2007 
Hamlin’s second attempt at the 500 didn’t go much better. After starting the race in 9 th , Hamlin finished the race a lap down in 28 th . ©, Brian Czobat, USA 2008 
The indication was that Hamlin hadn’t quite figured out the 2.5-mile superspeedway in his first few seasons. He started the race fourth after winning his Duel race but finished 17 th in the 500. 2009 
Another poor result came in 2009 for Hamlin. He started the race in 10 th and finished 26 th in the rain-shortened event. 2010 
After a strong showing in the previous year’s Coke Zero 400 at Daytona, where Hamlin finished third, it seemed like he might be trending in the right direction at the superspeedway. It wasn't the case. He started 25 th and finished 17 th . © LAT South LAT Photographic LAT South 2011 
Through his first six Daytona 500 appearances, Hamlin didn’t accomplish much to brag about. He once again finished outside the top 20 with a 21 st -place result, after starting 18 th . © , LAT South LAT South, LAT Photo USA 2012 
Hamlin finally broke through with a top-five finish in the Great American Race in 2012. A fourth-place finish started a streak of consistent performance by the driver of the No.11 JGR Toyota. Brian Czobat / autostock © 271 Fryling Ave SW Concord, NC 28025 W 704.786.2919 C 704.904.2745 autostock/Brian Czobat 2013 
A 14 th -place finish would have served as Hamlin’s best finish of his first six appearances in the Daytona 500 but it serves as his worst since 2012. He started the race 35 th before finishing just inside the top 15. (c) , Michael L. Levitt (c) 2013, Michael L. Levitt 2014 
Hamlin led 16 laps and finished second to Dale Earnhardt Jr. when the race ended under caution in 2014. It proved that he had figured out how to have success at Daytona. © , Michael L. Levitt © 2014, Michael L. Levitt 2015 
Once again, the race ended under caution in 2015 and Hamlin was right there vying for the lead when it finished. He ended up fourth, right behind Dale Earnhardt Jr. again. Joey Logano went on to win the race. Getty Images Getty Images 2016 
After years of struggling and then a few near misses, Hamlin beat Martin Truex Jr. by the narrowest margin in Daytona 500 history (0.010 seconds) and finally captured the Harley J. Earl Trophy last season. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images
